form.official-title: To amend title 41, United States Code, to require executive agencies to give priority to entities with on-site child care for employees in awarding certain contracts, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Child Care at Responsible Employers Act or the Child CARE Act.

section.header: Priority to entities with on-site child care for employees

subsection.header: Priority to entities with on-Site child care for employees

paragraph.text: Chapter 63 of title 41, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Priority to entities with on-site child care for employees

subsection.text: In awarding a contract for an amount exceeding $4,000,000, an executive agency shall give priority to any entity with on-site child care for the employees of the entity.

In awarding a contract described in subsection (a), an executive agency may not give priority to an offer from an entity described in such subsection over an offer from a small business concern (as defined in section 3 of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 632)).
In this section, the term executive agency has the meaning given that term in section 102 of title 40.

paragraph.text: The table of sections at the beginning of such chapter is amended by adding at the end the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 6310. Priority to entities with on-site child care for employees.

subsection.text: The amendment made by subsection (a)(1) shall apply with respect to contracts awarded on or after December 31, 2019.
